column1: text

Ladies, lets say you invited a guy you've been dating for a few weeks over to your place. Hypothetically, what would be the least awkward way for him to ask where the plunger is?


Purely hypothetical but due to unrelated reasons this might be time sensitive.
People whose S/Os are considered very attractive, what are your best stories of them getting hit on around you?

To those with SOs that work long hours and come home tired regularly: what can they do to reassure you they love you?


Working a tough job and often come home fatigued. Looking for inspiration to show her she’s still my spark.
What beauty habit/tip really upped your attractiveness level?

Ladies who are in long term relations (3, 5, 10 or more years), do you still get romantic surprises, do you still have passionate kisses and sweet cuddles? How did you manage to keep it this way?


If you don't mind, please mention if you're in same sex couple.
Single women who wants a relationship but never found anyone, how do you cope up with loneliness?

Whats the dumbest lie someone who you were dating said to you?


&#x200B;

If you've ever lived fully by yourself (i.e. no roommates), did it ever make you lonely? How did you manage it?

What's the number one thing in your 'girl code' ?

What is healthy self esteem? and how do you get it?

Women, what is the best part of your marriage?

Any adult women out there willing to admit they were one of the “mean girls” in high school? If so, how do you feel about that now, looking back?


[removed]
What is an argument or discussion you’ve had that has alienated you from friends, family, or people close to you?

Hey, AskWomen...do you ever knowingly code switch?


I mean in the broad sociological way.

For the uninitiated, it means changing the way you present and express different parts of your identity to people.

An example is [here in this video of Barack Obama](https://youtu.be/30-lYueJivk?t=27) in 2009. In the video which is in a hot dog restaurant in Chicago, the cashier asked him if he wants his change. He responded "Naw, we straight." He delivered his first Inaugural address the same month.

I'm more wondering about how you knowingly change how you present yourself in public on your own, rather than to fill familial/professional obligation.

Do you sometimes feel anxious after parties and blame yourself for not being good/funny/nice enough? How do you deal with it?


[removed]

What movies/tv shows do you have a hard time watching due to its sexism?


What movies or shows have made you feel uncomfortable due to its misogynistic undertones?

what are flaws that a viewed sympathetically/romantically in men but demonized in women?
